Last year, I believe it’s become clear that the hamburger is a subpar approach that screams desktop first. The reasoning is pretty simple: we create large, unnecessarily complex navigations for desktops and try to fit them on screens with far less real estate. Thus, the junk drawer is born, hiding even the primary navigation from the user.

  • Welcome to Improved

    January 12th 20162 min read

    Improved is a place where I can iterate on random ideas that go through my head, unified by the following principles.

    Read More →

    • A project by Darin Dimitroff. Set in Nitti Grotesk and served by Jekyll.

    • Close

    improved

    Improved is a project by Darin Dimitroff, product designer at The Crazy Ones.

    Developing complete visual overhauls and focusing solely on decoration is a thing among designers these days, especially on Dribbble. In a world of increasing complexity, we should strive to be recognized as engineers, not jewelers. My goal for Improved is to appreciate what great design teams have built and try to take it at least one tiny step further. Nothing more.

    TLDR: I see things that could be improved every day. This is a place where I explore ideas through writing and prototyping.
